place.name: LOVESTON
place.gazetteerText: LOVESTON, a parish in Narberth district, Pembroke; 5 miles SSW of Narberth, and 6½ NW of Tenby r. station. Post town, Narberth. Acres, 1,233. Real property, £736. Pop., 122. Houses, 26. The property is divided among a few. Anthracite is found. The living is a rectory in the diocese of St. David's. Value, £113. Patron, Baron de Rutzen. The church is good. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
